Print      Email      Share       Like                                                                Departmental Values   As a department, we adhere to a core set of values and beliefs that reflects both our diversity and our common interests. These core values and beliefs are as follows: We value both disciplinary-based and interdisciplinary training and research. We value interdisciplinary curiosity about organizations and willingness to learn about and contribute to areas of management outside one’s core area of expertise. We value, and seek to create, a culture of respect for different perspectives and opinions. We believe that managers can and do affect the strategic direction of firms and we are interested in a better understanding of issues related to strategic management. We believe it is important to consider the role of the organizational context in affecting behavior in, of, and among organizations. We share an interest in understanding the dynamics of organizational processes. Email      Share       Like                                              Faculty Openings     Positions Announcement    Department of Management and Organizations  Stern School of Business  New York University        The Department of Management and Organizations at the Stern School of Business, New York University, is seeking to hire in Organizational Behavior, Organization Theory and Strategy. We are open to candidates at all career levels (Assistant, Associate and Full). We are also seeking to fill one or more visiting positions. Candidates should have a PhD, or be assured of its completion within one year of the 2015-2016 academic year.    The Management and Organizations Department at Stern is diverse and inter-disciplinary. The Department consists of faculty with doctorate degrees in such fields as psychology, management, and business administration. The Department has long been recognized for its research and scholarship. It consistently ranks among the top schools in research productivity in leading journals.    The Stern School of Business is recognized internationally as being among the world’s best graduate and undergraduate business schools. Located in the heart of Greenwich Village in New York City, Stern has an internationally diverse faculty and student body. More information on Stern can be found at http://www.stern.nyu.edu/experience-stern/about/departments-centers-init... .    Applicants in Organizational Behavior should send their curriculum vitae, three letters of reference, samples of scholarly work, and teaching evaluations by October 15. Applicants in Organization Theory and Strategy should send these items by November 15.    Application materials for tenured/tenure-track positions should be submitted via the following website: http://apply.interfolio.com/25400 .    Application materials for visiting positions can be submitted here: http://apply.interfolio.com/25420 .
